title: Gut microbes with the
authors: Wu WK, Lo YL, Chiu JY, Hsu CL, Lo IH, Panyod S, Liao YC, Chiu THT, Yang YT, Kuo HC, Zou HB, Chen YH, Chuang HL, Yen JJY, Wang JT, Chiu HM, Hsu CC, Kuo CH, Sheen LY, Kao HL, Wu MS
abstract: Gut microbial metabolism of L-carnitine, which leads to the production of detrimental trimethylamine N-oxide (TMAO), offers a plausible link between red meat consumption and cardiovascular risks. Several microbial genes, including
